RECORD.TEXT: 9651828 Discharge Summary Unsigned DIS Unsigned NAME : UNIT NUMBER : 363-79-23 01/10/96 FINAL DIAGNOSIS : Cervical carcinoma ; bilateral ureteral obstruction secondary to the cancer . Uremia . Ileus . OPERATION : Bilateral ureteral stent placement . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : Postoperatively , she developed ileus , then finally she recovered and she was discharged to the nursing home . She was readmitted because of a problem with uremia and high BUN and creatinine when she seen in the office and the BUN and creatinine was ordered . The BUN was 70 and creatinine was 4.6 and for this reason she had ultrasound of the kidney which showed bilateral hydronephrosis . On the day of admission , she was generally stable and she had no evidence of disease in the pelvis , no bleeding and no other abnormality . Postoperatively , she diuresed very well . She had dropped her BUN and creatinine to normal and she was found to have may be metastatic disease to her skin on the right paraumbilical area . Because of her age and mental condition and the fact that she had cerebral atrophy , the decision was made for comfort unless she has any further problem and no further chemotherapy or treatment will be given . The possibility that she may need to receive radiation therapy to this area to prevent her from getting further obstruction was also brought up . FOLLOW-UP : DICTATING FOR : EARNRA HAWNSPANTKOTE , M.D. TR : yq DD : TD : cc : AZEL USANNE HIBBSKAYS , M.D. EARNRA HAWNSPANTKOTE , M.D.
